<JD_START>
Job Title: Corporate Accounting, Assistant Vice President

Location: Boston, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork â€“ the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

With over $41 trillion in assets under custody and administration, and over $4 trillion in assets under management as of September 30, 2022, State Street is a leading financial services provider serving some of the world's most sophisticated institutions. As a "Systemically Important Financial Institution" and a "Global Systemically Important Bank" as designated by the Financial Stability Board and the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision, State Street plays a key role in the global financial market infrastructure, and provides an exciting environment for career advancement.

Who we are looking for

The Corporate Accounting role at State Street is an exciting, challenging, and highly visible role supporting the Controllers Organization.

This role can be performed in a hybrid model, where you can balance work from home and office to match your needs and role requirements.

What you will be responsible for

Responsibilities

The successful candidate must be a detail-oriented and decisive individual with good analytical and research skills. Must be proficient in working with spreadsheets and databases and work autonomously. Must be capable of developing good working relationships with a wide variety of "customers" across the company. The following details specific responsibilities for the role:

Legal entity accounting:Prepare various month end statements: cash flow statement, equity roll-forward, variance analysisPrepare Board packageReview, analyze, and process accounting transactions, while adhering to GAAP accounting, and communicating issues to managerDevelop strong relationships with various groups throughout the organizationEnsure that regulatory, management and oversight of SOX reporting is completed accurately and timely. Comply with all controls including attestations, documentation and validation requirements Preparation of Goodwill scheduleInteraction with internal and external auditMonth end close process: Review legal entity financial statements (month over month, Qtr. over Qtr., Ytd over Ytd)Assist in the month end close process consisting of consolidation of subsidiaries and fluctuation analysis of various income statement and/or balance sheet accountsPrepare various monthly and quarterly external and internal management reports in a timely and accurate mannerAnalyze, reconcile, and report results of various account balances to management, to ensure accuracy of the balanceDevelop analytical tools and expertise to drill into the Corporation's financial records and evaluate its performance. Ad hoc research and assists manager with special tasks/projects
Education & Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor degree in finance, accounting or a related disciplineMinimum 5 years accounting related work experienceHigh level of integrity and trustworthiness handling sensitive informationPossession of good analytical and research skillsProficient in working with spreadsheets and databases (Oracle, Hyperion Essbase)Experience leading teams and building strong relationships in a dynamic environmentAbility to work in a fast paced environment and manage multiple deliverables and projects concurrentlyAbility to influence without authority, including more senior executivesAttention to detail and strong risk and control oriented mindsetExcellent written and verbal communication skills

About State Street

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we're making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we've been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.

Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.

Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.

State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Salary Range

$80,000 - $132,500 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
